attachments.title: From Barefoot to Fitbit
attachments.text: Over three glorious weeks in 1960, American television viewers were introduced to a thin man running the Olympic Marathon on the cobblestones of the Appian Way and a thick man running joyously from his job in a slate quarry. They were two heroes (Abebe Bikila and Fred Flintstone) in ancient cities (Rome and Bedrock), laboring in the shadows of beloved Wilmas (Rudolph and Flintstone). But what really united these runners at the dawn of that decade was what they wore on their feet: nothing.
